Boston Celtics vs Miami Heat Playoffs Round 3 Home Game 3
06/07/2012, at TD Garden
Best Value! $275 and up
Find Tickets

Boston.com
10
Celtics 94, Heat 90 > Celtics lead series, 3-2

Celtics get big win in Miami

Paul Pierce hit a clutch three-pointer over LeBron James with less than a minute left to put the Celtics up by four in Game 5 of the Eastern Conference Finals. Getty
Miami's Dwyane Wade and Udonis Haslem hounded Paul Pierce in the first quarter. Pierce finished with 19 points, including his late-game three-pointer. Globe Staff / Jim Davis
Dwyane Wade and LeBron James combined for 57 of Miami's 90 points, but it wasn't enough to stop the Celtics in Game 5. Getty Images
Kevin Garnett threw down this third-quarter dunk in spectacular fashion. Garnett led the Celtics with 26 points and 11 rebounds. Reuters
Rajon Rondo got tied up with Miami's Shane Battier on the floor as they battled for a loose ball in the first quarter. Rondo had 7 points with 13 assists. Globe Staff / Barry Chin
Chris Bosh returned from an abdominal strain and drew a standing ovation when he entered off the bench. Bosh finished with 9 points and 7 rebounds. Globe Staff / Jim Davis
Brandon Bass added 10 points for the Celtics, including this bucket he scored off an offensive rebound in the second quarter. Globe Staff / Barry Chin
Mickael Pietrus reacted after hitting a big second-half shot. Pietrus led the Boston bench in scoring with 13 points. Globe Staff / Jim Davis
Miami's Shane Battier fouled Ray Allen in the final seconds. Allen sunk both free throws and a possession later, Kevin Garnett hit two more to seal the win. Globe Staff / Barry Chin
Captain Paul Pierce celebrates with Doc Rivers and the Boston bench as the final buzzer sounds with Boston ahead, 94-90. Globe Staff / Jim Davis
  • Game 5: Celtics 94, Heat 90 | Box | Video Highlights

  • Celtics hung around then hung a loss on Heat in Game 5
  • Pierce master of the moment | Heat lapsed down stretch
  • Ryan: Stunning win | Video Ryan's analysis
  • Rivers, Pierce discuss big three-pointer | More reaction
  • OBF Video: Young Heat fan appreciates Miami effort

Not everyone's all-in on Suffolk casino

The concept of building a casino at Suffolk Downs was generally embraced in East Boston and Revere, even as some residents worried that gambling might spawn petty crime and alcohol-related incidents. (Globe)

State may prod Amazon for sales tax

The Patrick administration may require Amazon.com to start collecting sales tax, a move that would raise prices for online shoppers, but generate as much as $45 million in annual revenue for the state. (Globe)
